results.title: A Discussion in history
results.brief_description: Illustrates the technique of discussion as a method of teaching at senior high school level, and shows how a well-planned discussion may yield a deeper and clearer understanding of ideas. The subject of the french Revolution is introduced by the lecturer, who then leads the group in an unrehearsed discussion on various aspects of the subject.

results.title: Discovering the music of Japan
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: In a beautiful teahouse setting, three of the major Japanese instruments - the Koto, the Samisen and the Shakuhachi - are shown. Historical background on each instrument and the ways they fit into current Japanese life are explained. Includes traditional Japanese singing and dancing, and a performance by an ensemble of the three instruments. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Discovering the forest
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents the story of the forest community; discussing its conditions, forms of life and inter-relationships. The mood of the forest is established through its own atmosphere, sounds and life - there is no narration. Designed to encourage children to observe, and then interpret their observations.

results.title: Discovering texture (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jack Stoops, Paul Burnford and Film Associates
results.brief_description: Explains that every surface has texture and than an object may have several textures. Points out that we learn about textures by touching the surfaces of objects and looking at the way light reflects from these surfaces. Shows how paints, tools and materials are used to change the texture of surfaces.

results.title: Discovering perspective
results.creator_credit: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: We live in a world of depth and distance, which is called perspective. In drawing or painting on a flat surface, there are several ways in which to create the appearance of perspective: by overlapping and the placement of objects and lines, use of color, making objects clear or indistinct, and varying the size of objects.

results.title: Discharge through gases
results.brief_description: Using experiments, animation and diagrams, this film shows and explains discharge patterns in rarefied gases. Studies the phenomena produced inside a glass tube fitted with two electrodes when a high voltage is applied and the air pressure in the tube is reduced by a vacuum pump. Starting from spark discharge in air, the parts of discharge are identified; deflection of cathode rays by magnetic or electrostatic fields, ionization by collision, breakdown voltage and excitation of the atom by free electrons are explained.
results.description: Using experiments, animation and diagrams, this film shows and explains discharge patterns in rarefied gases. results.title: Dirty business
results.creator_credit: Rob Grant, Ian Fowler and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A comedy in which two young men turn to burglary for easy money, but find their attempts foiled when one finds himself locked in a bathroom. Stars Jan Marnell, Simon Beattie, George Vidalis and Alethea MacGrath.

results.title: The Diode: principles and applications
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of electron flow across a gap, basic features of the diode tube, control of the electron flow in the tube, photoelectric cells, x-ray tubes, and the diode as a rectifier.

results.title: Dinnawan the emu
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Wild Life”.
The emu, found only in Australia, is second in size to the ostrich. Like the ostrich it is unable to fly, but with its long and powerful legs is able to run at great speeds. Traces the history of the emu from when it roamed over the whole continent and Tasmania. European settlement has led to the extermination of the emu except in Central Australia. Shows laying of eggs, the male emu keeping the nest, hatching chicks and two years growth to full size.

results.title: The Difference
results.brief_description: Describes emergency treatment for excessive bleeding, failure in breathing, and cardiac arrest. Details the kind of first aid a non-professional can and should perform in case of an accident or emergency until professional help is available. Explains the needs of the bring and the consequences if the brains is denied oxygen for even a short amount of time.
